title: Survivors and leaders mark Holocaust Memorial Day
description: Holocaust survivors and international leaders honour victims of the Nazis.

title: Ronnies and trousers: Barry Cryer's BBC moments
description: How Barry Cryer made us laugh on the BBC over his long performing and writing career.

title: Covid vaccines: The unvaccinated NHS workers facing the sack
description: NHS staff explain why they have chosen not to have a Covid vaccine as the mandatory deadline looms.

title: Quiz of the week: Damon Albarn prefers which artist to Taylor Swift?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Man says he drove without licence for more than 70 years
description: The man, in his 80s, tells police he has been driving with no licence or insurance since he was 12.

title: Covid passes and face mask rules end in England
description: The legal measures are dropped but some shoppers and commuters will still be asked to wear face coverings.

title: BBC Radio 3 to shine light on 'forgotten' composers
description: The station will premiere forgotten orchestral works by composers from diverse ethnic backgrounds.

title: Jay Blades on how The Repair Shop supports his dyslexia
description: The presenter opens up about living with the learning difficulty in a new BBC documentary.

title: Ukraine crisis: BBC tries to track down official bomb shelters in Kyiv
description: Ukrainian authorities have mapped out Kyiv's bomb shelters, but can the BBC's Sarah Rainsford find them?

title: Derby County's administrators given extra month to provide proof of funding for season
description: Derby County's administrators are given an extra month to provide proof of how the club will be funded for the rest of the season.

title: Universal Credit: Jobseekers told to widen job search faster or face cut
description: Those on Universal Credit must look for work outside their chosen field quicker or face sanctions.

title: Man and girl found dead at Dorset beauty spot
description: The pair, both in their late teens, were found by police on Tuesday morning.

title: Barry Cryer: Veteran comedian and writer dies aged 86
description: Stephen Fry, Gyles Brandreth and David Mitchell are among the stars paying tribute to the comedian.

title: Covid: Care home restrictions to be eased in England
description: From Monday, there will be no limit on visits to care homes and self-isolation periods will be cut.

title: Barty reaches first Australian Open final and faces American Collins
description: Ashleigh Barty becomes the first home player to reach the Australian Open women's singles final in 42 years and will play Danielle Collins on Saturday.

title: Holocaust survivor: 'Those chosen to live got a number on their arm'
description: Arek Hersh speaks about his experience of arriving at Nazi death camp Auschwitz-Birkenau.

title: Train firms bet on mindfulness to lure commuters back
description: Free hot drinks and other perks are on offer as train bosses try to get passenger numbers back on track.

title: Prince Andrew denies close friendship with Ghislaine Maxwell in US court files
description: In US court files, the prince, who denies assault claims, also asks for a jury trial in his accuser's lawsuit.

title: Ukraine crisis: US rejects Russian demand to bar Ukraine from Nato
description: Russia says the response does not address its concerns about Nato, but "gives hope" over other issues.

title: Barry Cryer obituary: A life dedicated to laughter
description: He provided the words for many of Britain's top comedy acts and was on the stage and airwaves himself.

title: Sandbach baby born at 23 weeks goes home for first time
description: Rachel Morgans' daughter Bonnie leaves hospital four months after a complicated delivery.

title: Covid: Care home rules to ease and end of masks and Covid passes in England
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Thursday morning.

title: Australia on top as dropped catches hurt England in Ashes Test
description: Missed chances hurt England as Australia take control of the crucial Ashes Test on day one in Canberra.

title: Winter Olympics quiz: Test your knowledge of the Games
description: Test your knowledge of the Winter Olympics as we build up to the 2022 Beijing Games, which run from 4-20 February.

title: The Papers: Prince Andrew demands 'trial by jury'
description: Most papers report on a demand by Prince Andrew's lawyers to have a US jury trial in Virginia Giuffre's case.

title: Pet cat missing for 11 years reunited with owners
description: Fergus was found in Aberdeen earlier this month after going missing in Moray in 2010.

title: 'It is a sleeping giant' - meet the Englishman bidding to end Canada's World Cup misery
description: BBC Sport's Simon Stone talks to Canada's English coach John Herdman, who has taken them to the verge of World Cup qualification.

title: Is this England's earliest report of ball lightning?
description: Earliest known report of rare ball lightning in England discovered by researchers at Durham University

title: 'I had to pay for Tourette's diagnosis'
description: Edie Pilkington, 16, says it was a relief to have the condition confirmed by a private consultant.

title: Burkina Faso coup: Return of the military strongmen to West Africa
description: Burkina Faso is the latest country to experience a coup in a region where democracy had seemed entrenched.

title: What is the quantum apocalypse and should we be scared?
description: Security experts say a quantum computing leap could crack open all our secrets - so should we worry?

title: My job: What it's like digging graves for a living
description: Mark Sealey, who has been in his job for more than 40 years, describes what the day-to-day involves.

title: How streaming services left us with too much to watch
description: Multiple platforms streaming new TV shows and films risk leaving people overwhelmed by choice.

title: Powell's brilliant century leads West Indies to T20 win over England
description: Rovman Powell hits a majestic century to lead West Indies to a 20-run victory over England in the third Twenty20 in Barbados.

title: Mark Cavendish: The Tour de France comeback for 'cycling's greatest sprinter'
description: Mark Cavendish's enthralling comeback at last summer's Tour de France brought him level with a cycling legend. Will he be back this year?

title: The 100-year-old volunteer with no plans to stop
description: Meet Beryl, the 100-year-old volunteer who is still making drinks at Ealing Hospital.

title: Rose Ayling-Ellis calls for British Sign Language recognition
description: More than 150,000 people use British Sign Language across the UK, with around 87,000 relying on it.

title: Life under the Taliban: Yalda Hakim's journey back to Afghanistan
description: With access to the new Taliban government, Yalda Hakim travels back to Afghanistan to find out what the country is like under their rule.
